Diplomatic: Arrane Mannanagh – Va dheiney skillonnan mennick goaill arrane
(Ayns yn aght screeu yn Ned Beg Hom Ruy eh):

Manx: Va deiney Skeeyl Lonan mennick goaill arrane
English: The men of Lonan were often singing
Diplomatic: Va dheiney Skillonnan mennick ghoaill arrane

Manx: Ayns thie Ballagraw harrish jough
English: In Ballagraw house over a drink
Diplomatic: Ayns thie Ballagraw harrish jogh

Manx: Jeh kirree fo niaghtee as Mylecraine
English: Of sheep under snow, and Mylecaraine
Diplomatic: Jeh keeree fo niaghtee as Molleycarrane

Manx: As pintyn roie harrish lesh frough
English: And pints running over with froth
Diplomatic: As Phintyn roie harrish lesh frogh
Notes: Frough— Screeu Ned Beg ‘frogh’ ta Cregeen cur ‘rotten’ rish. Ta Kelly cur ‘a fog’ rish ‘frough’. T’eh feer phossible dy beagh fockle mee-voylley ec Ned Beg rish jough, agh t’eh kiart cha liklee dy re ‘frough’ ta’n fockle cadjin rish ‘kesh lionney’.

Manx: Agh ga dy vel ooilley yn sleih shen ersooyl
English: But though all those people are gone
Diplomatic: Agh gha dy vel ooilley yn sleih shen ersooyl

Manx: As paart jeu jarroodit dy liooar
English: And some of them forgotten enough
Diplomatic: As paart jiu jarroodyt dy lioar

Manx: Cha vel ad er vaagail carraneyn nyn gooyl
English: They haven’t (so much as) left carranes behind them
Diplomatic: Cha vel ad er vaigail carraanyn nyn gooyl

Manx: Syn niarragh dy hooyl ayns yn ooir
English: To walk in the soil in the Spring
Diplomatic: Syn niarragh dy hooyl ayns yn ooir

Manx: Ny yeih ta’n imbagh dy feayraght ayn nish
English: Nevertheless, the season of cold is here now
Diplomatic: Ny yeih ta yn imbagh dy feearagh ayn nish

Manx: As kirree rouail noon as noal
English: And sheep wandering to and fro
Diplomatic: As keereee rouaill noon as noall

Manx: Ta boght ny heirinnee jeeaghyn magh eisht
English: The poor farmers are looking out then
Diplomatic: Te bogh ny eirinnee jeeaghyn magh esht

Manx: Nagh jean ad ny kirree y choayl
English: That they don’t lose the sheep
Diplomatic: Nagh jean ad ny keeree y coall

Manx: Son ta’n niarragh er jeet lesh feayraght as rio
English: Because the Spring has come with cold and ice
Diplomatic: Son ta’n niarragh er jeet lesh feearagh as rio

Manx: Ta’n aer jeeaghyn quaagh dy mie
English: The sky looks well strange
Diplomatic: Ta’n aer jeaghyn quiagh dy mie

Manx: My hig eh er sniaghtey ny kirree vees fo
English: If it manages to snow the sheep will be under
Diplomatic: My hig e er sniaghtey ny kerree vess fo

Manx: Eisht gow shiu dy gheddyn ad thie
English: Then you’ll go to get them home
Diplomatic: Eisht ghow shiu dy gheddyn ad thie

Manx: Ta’n gheay feayr nish sheidey er voish yn neear-hwoaie
English: The cold wind now blows from the north-east
Diplomatic: Ta’n gheay feear nish sheidey er voish yn nearhwoaie

Manx: As bodjalyn dorraghey gaase
English: And clouds grow dark
Diplomatic: As bodjalyn dorraghey gaase

Manx: Nagh faag shiu ny kirree as colbeeyn mooie
English: Don’t leave the sheep and heifers out
Diplomatic: Nagh faig shiu ny kerree as colbeeyn moie

Manx: Agh gow shiu kiarail jeh’n maase
English: But take care of the cattle
Diplomatic: Agh gow shiu karraill jeh yn maase

Manx: Son shimmey cretoor boght ta’n sniaghtey er stroie
English: For many is the poor creature the snow has destroyed
Diplomatic: Son shinney cretoor bogh ta’n sniaghtey er stroie

Manx: Syn imbagh ta shaghey er gholl
English: In the season that has gone past
Diplomatic: Syn imbagh ta shaghey er gholl

Manx: Dy mennick va riojit ny lhie rish ny cleigh
English: Often were frozen lying by the hedges
Diplomatic: Dy mennick va riojyt ny lhie rish ny chleigh

Manx: Ny rouail ersooyl veih nyn oayl
English: Or wandering away from their home
Diplomatic: Ny rouaill ersooyl veih nyn oayl

Manx: Esht jean shiu goaill tastey as kiarrail ayns traa
English: Then take heed and take care and in time
Diplomatic: Esht jean shiu ghoaill tastey as kaarraill ayns tra

Manx: Dy haglym ny shellooyn stiagh
English: To gather the herds in
Diplomatic: Dy haglym ny shellooyn stiagh

Manx: As nish troggal erriu ayns soiljey yn laa
English: And now get up in the light of day
Diplomatic: As nish troggal erroo ayns soiljey yn laa

Manx: Dy hauail yn maase voish yn chragh
English: To save the cattle from disaster
Diplomatic: Dy hauaill yn maase voish yn chragh

Manx: Ny eayin as yn feayraght gys fastee yn chlea
English: The lambs out ot the cold to the shelter of the hedge
Diplomatic: Ny eeayn as yn feearagh gys fastee yn chlea

Manx: As eiyr shiu ad sheese veih yn clieau
English: And chase them down from the mountain
Diplomatic: As eiyr shiu ad sheese veih yn chlieu

Manx: As nyn moiraghyn neesht dy vod ad goaill fea
English: And their mothers too so that they may rest
Diplomatic: As nyn moiraghyn neesht dy vod ad ghoaill fea

Manx: Shoh cliaghtey t'er ve er dy rieau
English: This is a custom that has always been
Diplomatic: Shoh chliaghtey te’r ve er dy rieu
